intro: Thesium bulgaricum, commonly known as the Balkan thesium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. Thesium bulgaricum is typically found in dry, rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny, arid environments.
